CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 18, reads: "Ammon Sports Award Night - More than 200 persons crowded into the Terrace Room of the Terrace Hall Hotel, last week, to celebrate the fourth annual Award Night, sponsored by the Ammon Center Recreation League.  Beautiful trophies were given to the winning team and players in the Ammon Recreation Slow Pitch League...  Right photo, at the speakers' table, W. P. Young, former basketball and baseball great; Constable Smith, Charles Betts, instructor at Ammon Recreation Center, and Sir Walter, well-known disc jockey at radio station WAMO, who emceed the affair.  Standing, left to right: Bernard (Process Pete) Peters, chairman, and 'Chick' Jones, co-chairman of the Awards Night."
TitMainTitle: William P. Young, Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, Charles Betts, and John "Sir Walter" Christian seated behind table, with Bernard "Process Pete" Peters, and "Chick Jones" behind them, at Ammon Center award night, Terrace Hall Hotel
